examples: We travelled across the desert on camelback.

entries.meaning: (countable) A flexible water container worn on the back.
examples: An empty camelback is a blessing and a curse: it is easy to carry, but it means you have no water.

entries.meaning: (countable) A house with a second storey that does not completely cover the ground floor.
examples: My friend lived in a camelback; we used to have fun climbing out of the window onto the roof below.

entries.meaning: (countable, rail transport) A railway locomotive that has its cab in the middle as opposed to at the end.
examples: The camelbacks were designed to help with the visibility problems inherent in putting the driver behind the entire engine.
He fell back relieved into his favourite camelback with a gin and tonic.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) A type of rubber used in tyre restoration.
examples: We require four million tons of camelback each year.
The camelback rubber produced in this plant is shipped around the world.
